summary:
A detail-focused data-driven individual with knowledge of business analysis with a profound two years of expertise using data analysis skills to drive business value as a Sales Analyst and Client
Management in the Retail Food Industry (Fast Moving Consumable Goods), and as a Research Analyst.

authors.headline: Data Analytics | Power BI | SQL | Tableau | R | Excel

profile_positions.description:
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify business goals and objectives, and prioritize BI projects to support these goals.

Utilize Power BI, Excel, R, and other relevant tools to develop BI solutions and provide insights on business performance.

Work with suppliers to establish clear communication channels, data exchange protocols, and data quality standards.

Utilize your expertise in data exchange to identify the best approach for data integration and troubleshoot any issues that arise.

Deliver effective reporting and insights by analyzing data to gain insights into business performance and presenting the data in a clear and concise manner.
profile_positions.title: Sales Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Analyzed statistical data using both modern and traditional methods.
Gathered, arranged and corrected research data to create representative graphs and charts highlighting results for presentations.
Recorded data about experimentation, prepared biological samples for analysis and followed proper protocols to ensure that they were stored, prepared, and disposed of efficiently and effectively.
Operated, calibrated, and performed routine maintenance on specialised equipment (such as Osborne FIRE Feeder) and maintained supply inventory.
Supervised and trained new PhD, Masters and Undergraduate Students on the use of Osborne FIRE feeder for pigs.
Analyzed research data for PhD, Master's Students and Other Academic using Excel and Statistical/Data analytical software such as SAS and R.
Offered suggestions and direction from analysis to help guide research officer's decision-making.
Jointly developed research protocol that would address their research question for Masters and PhD research thesis.
profile_positions.title: Research Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Provided analytics and visualization (Excel or Tableau) for customer selling calls and internal business reviews.
Reviewed contracts for accuracy and validity of cost and quote information, contacting customers directly to resolve issues when appropriate.
Gathered and analyzed data for sales reports and product feedback daily to the Area Sales Manager related to implementing sales strategies in my territory.
Managed over 4 foot-sales-rep in my territory to drive growth.
Queried sales database using SQL to get data for analysis. 
Analyzed sales and market data and provided valuable feedback and actionable insights to guide data-driven decision-making, such as promotional and sales activities.
Reviewed past sales data to determine trends in productivity.
Managed 10 key accounts, developed relationships with clients and anticipated and forecasted client needs and requirements.
Ensured monthly and project targets were met and exceeded
Received client orders and ensured they were processed quickly and efficiently.
Gained and shared knowledge of competition and their products with the sales and product development team.
Oversee implementation of sales programs by developing sales action plans for my territory.
Consistently commended for a 35% increase in Year-Till-Date and 25% Monthly growth in my territory.
Established greater 54% effective coverage for secondary sales and a corresponding increase in value sales, billed productivity and total line sold for team Foot and Van Sales Rep.
Fostered lasting relationships with customers through effective communication and quick response, resulting in long-term loyalty and an expanded client base.
profile_positions.title: Sales Analyst

profile_positions.description:
•Prepare and submit sales report as well as product feedback on a daily and weekly basis to Area Sales Manager as it relate to the implementation of the sales strategies in my territory.
•	Develop relationships with the customers and be able to anticipate and forecast customer needs and requirements.
•	Make Sales Calls and receive customer orders thereby ensuring they are processed in a timely and efficient manner.
•	Gain and share with the sales team knowledge of the competition and their products.
•	Supervise and manage field sales representatives as well van sales representatives in ensuring they meet up with monthly or annual sales target.
•	Identify opportunities for upcoming products development and enhancement of existing products.
*       Researches sources for developing prospective customers and for information to determine their potential
*       Keep abreast of market conditions, competitive activities, advertising and promotional trends.
*       Supply management with oral and written reports on customer needs, problem, interests, competition activities and potential for new products and services
*       Plan and organize personal sales strategy by maximizing the Return on Time investment for the territory/segment

* Manage Sales Account in the Territory 

*Caring for a geographical region consisting of International Customers, Wholesalers, and Smaller stores, building strong relationships with all parties.

*Delivering volume & leadership in-store presence.

Articulating and executing appropriate go-to-market strategies for new geographies/categories into which the distributor is expanding business.

Preparing volume forecast and plans.

Collaborating very closely with teams from other departments to assist in delivering excellent end-to-end customer service delivery & response to market trends & needs.

Resolve any issues and problems of your clients and act as a link between your customer and the internal teams.
profile_positions.title: Sales Officer (Management Trainee)

profile_positions.description:
•	Prepare reports and recommend procedure as it relate to the best and efficient storage of agro commodities in the warehouse.
•	Liaise with farmers and on field enumerators for daily market commodity price update.
•	Periodically update the website of Novus Agro with daily and weekly commodity price for researchers and consumers alike.
•	Actively participate in the training of enumerators and farmers in line with agricultural best practices.
profile_positions.title: Agriculturist

profile_positions.description:
Create at least 5 fan engaging sport articles a week

Increase site traffic with targeted SEO strategies encapsulated in the published article
profile_positions.title: Content Writer for Football (Intern)

company.name: NNEWI SOUTH LOCAL GOVERNMENT SECRETARIAT (Department of Agriculture) –

profile_positions.company: NNEWI SOUTH LOCAL GOVERNMENT SECRETARIAT (Department of Agriculture) –
profile_positions.description:
•	Design agricultural programs to fit the desire of the native population.
•	Operate as a facilitator in helping native farmers in their decision-making and ensuring that appropriate research knowledge are implemented to obtain the best results.
•	Provide access to information and extension services as well as create market for the farmers produce.
•	Compile and maintain technical notebook of all completed works and cost estimates.
•	Assist in other functions to ensure operational actions are completed in time.
profile_positions.title: Agricultural Technical Officer (NYSC – Place of Primary Assignment)

company.name: International Postgraduate and Mature Student Club - Massey University

volunteer_experiences.description: The club aims to develop and promote cross-cultural friendships amongst international student from different part of the world which form such a great part of Massey  University

● Advocate for students to the University about international student-related issues
● In partnership with the MUSA Equity and Welfare portfolios, meet regularly with the
International Postgraduate and Mature Student Society, plus other relevant clubs
and associations (i.e cultural clubs).
● Coordinate MUSA’s submissions to the University and external bodies on
international student issues.
● Maintain relations with key community organisations or persons relevant to
international students.
● Assist with the MUSA International Buddies Handbook and any other international
based publication.
● Coordinates and leads the International Buddy Programme in conjunction with the
Student Engagement Coordinator and International Student Support.
● Maintain a strong working relationship with the MUSA Advocate and Clubs and
Events Coordinator.
● Maintain positive relationships with all relevant Massey Student Services and their
Managers.
● As an Executive Officer, ensure compliance with the Association’s legal
responsibilities.
● Assist the President by performing such special tasks/projects as may be delegated
at the President’s discretion.
● Organise and run at least one event per semester.
